title: How to Install a Water Softener

steps.title: Shut off the water to the house and turn off the power to the hot water heater.
steps.content: Shut off the water to the house and turn off the power to the hot water heater. [1] X Research source Read all the directions that came with your water softener before you began the installation.

steps.title: Turn on all the faucets and outside hoses to drain your water lines before you put in a water softener.
steps.content: Turn on all the faucets and outside hoses to drain your water lines before you put in a water softener. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Position your water conditioner in a dry, safe area that is level.
steps.content: Position your water conditioner in a dry, safe area that is level. Most water softeners have 2 tanks, and you need to set them next to each other.

steps.title: Measure the length between the cold water line and the bypass ports on the water softener tank with a measuring tape.
steps.content: Measure the length between the cold water line and the bypass ports on the water softener tank with a measuring tape. Cut a piece of copper tubing that length, and solder fittings on the ends. Water conditioner installation includes some soldering work. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Follow the manufacturer's direction to install the discharge tube on the water softener head.
steps.content: Follow the manufacturer's direction to install the discharge tube on the water softener head.

steps.title: Run the overflow tube that's attached to the side of the water conditioner tank and the discharge tube to a drain.
steps.content: Run the overflow tube that's attached to the side of the water conditioner tank and the discharge tube to a drain. With water softener installation, you must provide drainage. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Put the bypass valve on to the water conditioner's head valve.
steps.content: Put the bypass valve on to the water conditioner's head valve. Adjust the screws on the stainless steel clamps with a screwdriver to seat the valve. When you install a water softener, be sure to have all your tools ready.

steps.title: Connect the copper tubing that delivers water to the bypass valve.
steps.content: Connect the copper tubing that delivers water to the bypass valve. Use a wrench to tighten the supply tube nuts. When you put in a water softener, don't wrench the nuts too tight.

steps.title: Attach the copper tubing from the water conditioner to the water lines.
steps.content: Attach the copper tubing from the water conditioner to the water lines. Scrub the fittings and the pipes with steel wool. When installing a water conditioner, you'll need to solder the fitting to the pipes. Solder the fittings together by applying flux and melting it with a propane torch.

steps.title: Turn your electric heater and the water to the house back on.
steps.content: Turn your electric heater and the water to the house back on.

steps.title: Plug the control valve in and put about 4 gallons (15.142 liters) of water into the brine tank.
steps.content: Plug the control valve in and put about 4 gallons (15.142 liters) of water into the brine tank. Water softener installation includes setting up the brine tank, and you'll need to add 40 lbs. (18.144 kg) of potassium chloride salt or sodium chloride to the unit. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Put your conditioner into the backwash stage and set the bypass valve to the service position.
steps.content: Put your conditioner into the backwash stage and set the bypass valve to the service position. To put in a water softener, open the water supply valve to the 1/4 position to let oxygen run from the drain line.

steps.title: Turn the water supply valve completely on when a steady stream of water appears at the drain.
steps.content: Turn the water supply valve completely on when a steady stream of water appears at the drain.

steps.title: Let the conditioner run through the complete backwash cycle when installing a water softener.
steps.content: Let the conditioner run through the complete backwash cycle when installing a water softener.

steps.title: Test the system for leaks.
steps.content: Test the system for leaks. If any water is escaping, check your soldering and the nuts. Re-solder or tighten nuts to repair any leaks.
